history.proof: intros prog post. intros H e Hexec. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment prog : ImpProg post : Pred H : E.Env e : (prog [=post =]) H Hexec : E.Env Unable to unify "(fix synt_wp (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) {struct prog} : Pred := fun e : E.Env => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => (E.eval cond e = true -> synt_wp p1 post e) /\\ (E.eval cond e = false -> synt_wp p2 post e) | Iseq p1 p2 => synt_wp p1 (synt_wp p2 post) e | Iwhile cond p => exists (inv : Pred) (R : E.Env -> E.Env -> Prop), well_founded R /\\ inv e /\\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = false -> post e') /\\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = true -> synt_wp p inv e') /\\ (forall e0 : E.Env, inv e0 -> E.eval cond e0 = true -> synt_wp p (fun e1 : E.Env => R e1 e0) e0) end) ?M1506 ?M1507 ?M1508" with "exec H prog Hexec".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), prog [=post =] |= prog {=post =}

Premises:
Inductive ImpProg : Type := Iskip : ImpProg | Iset : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> E.Expr A -> ImpProg | Iif : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iseq : ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iwhile : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg Arguments Iset [A]%type_scope
Pred = E.Env -> Prop : Type
PHL.wp_complete : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), prog {=post =} |= PHL.synt_wp prog post
wp_complete : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), prog [=post =] |= synt_wp prog post
wp_sound : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), synt_wp prog post |= prog [=post =]
PHL.wp_sound : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), PHL.synt_wp prog post |= prog {=post =}
PHL.completeness : forall (pre : E.Env -> Type) (p : ImpProg) (post : Pred), pre |= p {=post =} -> pre |= PHL.synt_wp p post
soundness : forall (pre : E.Env -> Type) (p : ImpProg) (post : Pred), pre |= synt_wp p post -> pre |= p [=post =]
PHL.soundness : forall (pre : E.Env -> Type) (p : ImpProg) (post : Pred), pre |= PHL.synt_wp p post -> pre |= p {=post =}
completeness : forall (pre : E.Env -> Type) (p : ImpProg) (post : Pred), pre |= p [=post =] -> pre |= synt_wp p post
wlp = fun (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) (e : E.Env) => exec e prog |= post : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
exec_inversion : forall (prog : ImpProg) (e e' : E.Env), exec e prog e' -> forall post : Pred, aux_wlp prog post e -> post e'
wp = fun (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) (e : E.Env) => exists e' : E.Env, exec e prog e' /\ post e' : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
aux_wlp = fun (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) (e : E.Env) => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) |= post | Iseq p1 p2 => forall e1 e2 : E.Env, exec e p1 e1 -> exec e1 p2 e2 -> post e2 | Iwhile cond p => exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= post end : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
synt_wp_monotonic : forall (p : ImpProg) (post1 post2 : Pred), post1 |= post2 -> synt_wp p post1 |= synt_wp p post2
PHL.synt_wp_monotonic : forall (p : ImpProg) (post1 post2 : Pred), post1 |= post2 -> PHL.synt_wp p post1 |= PHL.synt_wp p post2
PHL.synt_wp = fix synt_wp (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) {struct prog} : Pred := fun e : E.Env => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => (E.eval cond e = true -> synt_wp p1 post e) /\ (E.eval cond e = false -> synt_wp p2 post e) | Iseq p1 p2 => synt_wp p1 (synt_wp p2 post) e | Iwhile cond p => exists inv : Pred, inv e /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = false -> post e') /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = true -> synt_wp p inv e') end : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
synt_wp = fix synt_wp (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) {struct prog} : Pred := fun e : E.Env => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => (E.eval cond e = true -> synt_wp p1 post e) /\ (E.eval cond e = false -> synt_wp p2 post e) | Iseq p1 p2 => synt_wp p1 (synt_wp p2 post) e | Iwhile cond p => exists (inv : Pred) (R : E.Env -> E.Env -> Prop), well_founded R /\ inv e /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = false -> post e') /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = true -> synt_wp p inv e') /\ (forall e0 : E.Env, inv e0 -> E.eval cond e0 = true -> synt_wp p (fun e1 : E.Env => R e1 e0) e0...
exec_deterministic : forall (ei : E.Env) (p : ImpProg) (ef : E.Env), exec ei p ef -> exec ei p |= eq ef
Inductive exec : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env ->...-> exec e (Iseq p1 p2) e'' | exec_Iwhile : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= exec e (Iwhile cond p) Arguments exec_Iset [A]%type_scope Arguments exec_Iif [e] _ _ _ [e'] Arguments exec_Iseq [e p1 p2 e' e''] Arguments exec_Iwhile [e cond p e']
exec_execn : forall (ei : E.Env) (p : ImpProg) (ef : E.Env), exec ei p ef -> exists n : nat, execn n ei p ef
Inductive execn : nat -> E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env ->...-> execn n e (Iseq p1 p2) e'' | execn_Iwhile : forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), execn n e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= execn (S n) e (Iwhile cond p) Arguments execn _%nat_scope Arguments execn_Iset [A]%type_scope Arguments execn_Iif [n]%nat_scope [e] _ _ _ [e'] Arguments execn_Iseq [n]%nat_scope [e p1 p2 e' e''] Arguments execn_Iwhile [n]%nat_scope [e cond p e']
exec_ind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> Prop, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), exec e i |= P e i
exec_sind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> SProp, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), exec e i |= P e i
exec_Iseq : forall (e : E.Env) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' e'' : E.Env), exec e p1 e' -> exec e' p2 e'' -> exec e (Iseq p1 p2) e''
exec_Iwhile : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= exec e (Iwhile cond p)
exec_Iif_false : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), E.eval cond e = false -> exec e p2 e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'
exec_Iif_true : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), E.eval cond e = true -> exec e p1 e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'
execn_Iseq : forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' e'' : E.Env), exec e p1 e' -> execn n e' p2 e'' -> execn n e (Iseq p1 p2) e''
synt_wp_conj : forall (p : ImpProg) (post1 post2 : Pred) (e : E.Env), synt_wp p post1 e -> synt_wp p post2 e -> synt_wp p (fun e0 : E.Env => post1 e0 /\ post2 e0) e
exec_Iif : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) |= exec e (Iif cond p1 p2)
execn_ind : forall P : nat -> E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> Prop, (forall e : E.Env, P 0 e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P 0 e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), execn n e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P n e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P n e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), execn n e i |= P n e i
execn_sind : forall P : nat -> E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> SProp, (forall e : E.Env, P 0 e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P 0 e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), execn n e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P n e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P n e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), execn n e i |= P n e i
execn_Iwhile : forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), execn n e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= execn (S n) e (Iwhile cond p)
execn_Iif : forall (n : nat) (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg), execn n e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) |= execn n e (Iif cond p1 p2)
Relation_Operators.symprod_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A * B -> A * B -> Prop), (forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, P (x, y) (x', y)) -> (forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, P (x, y) (x, y')) -> forall p : A * B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB p |= P p
Field_theory.AF_AR : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv |= Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : R x |= Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope
ssrbool.SimplPred = fun (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) => ssrfun.SimplFun p : ssrbool.pred |= ssrbool.simpl_pred Arguments ssrbool.SimplPred {T}%type_scope
Field_theory.rsplit_common = fun (C : Type) (r : Field_theory.rsplit C) => let (_, rsplit_common, _) := r in rsplit_common : Field_theory.rsplit |= Ring_polynom.PExpr Arguments Field_theory.rsplit_common [C]%type_scope
Field_theory.rsplit_right = fun (C : Type) (r : Field_theory.rsplit C) => let (_, _, rsplit_right) := r in rsplit_right : Field_theory.rsplit |= Ring_polynom.PExpr Arguments Field_theory.rsplit_right [C]%type_scope
Field_theory.rsplit_left = fun (C : Type) (r : Field_theory.rsplit C) => let (rsplit_left, _, _) := r in rsplit_left : Field_theory.rsplit |= Ring_polynom.PExpr Arguments Field_theory.rsplit_left [C]%type_scope

```intros prog post.
unfold entails; unfold_PHL_wp synt_wp.
intros H e Hexec.
apply wp_sound.
apply H.
apply Hexec.
```
